column28: I once hit enter (by accident) without typing input, and the conversation ended right away - perhaps a default confirmation ('do you want to end the conversation?') would be useful. Another time I got stuck in a mode where the program did not sensibly reply to anything I said, but when I typed 'can we start again please?' it did!! Very cool

column26: It was pretty nice!
column28: I kept ending conversations by creating an error by pressing enter... I knew it was not the intended method, but when I figured out it worked after making a mistake in the first task it just made more sense to me than ending by actually saying goodbye to the program.

column26: Interesting alternative to going through endless pages of Tripadvisor
column27: The program sounds a bit robot-like, but there was enthusiasm in the tone, so it was not too bad. The overall use was very clear.
column28: Once it freaked out and it finished that conversation without giving me a recommendation, but it was not annoying.

column26: it is okay, but I had to learn how to use it

column27: The program was faster than google and looking for a location or price range seemed useful. It had times sometimes when it didn't understand me when I type a spelling wrong but otherwise it was similar to a normal conversation.

column26: Seems cool, pity that it doesn't work for Utrecht!
